definition: sticking unmoving to the original (idiom); not an iota changed/untouched
Hara (Japanese surname)
former/original/primary/raw/level/cause/source
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
(negative prefix)/not/no
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: All the things in the room were kept changeless.
sentences.chinese: 房间里的所有东西都保持原封不动。

sentences.english: A pearl necklace I had given you lay untouched in its little casket;
sentences.chinese: 我送你的一根珍珠项链，原封不动地留在小盒子里。

sentences.english: Copy the spirit of the original not do it verbatim.
sentences.chinese: 要学原文的神，切不可原封不动照搬。

sentences.english: He took the bundle just as it was to the police-station.
sentences.chinese: 他把那包裹原封不动地送到警察局去了。

sentences.english: Some letters come back unopened, with a black stamp.
sentences.chinese: 有些信被原封不动的退了回来，盖了个黑印戳。

sentences.english: He bought the samovar as is from an antique dealer.
sentences.chinese: 他原封不动地从古董商那里买到这套俄国式茶具。

sentences.english: The letter was returned to him unopened.
sentences.chinese: 这封信被原封不动地退了回来。

sentences.english: Files with other suffixes would be left untouched.
sentences.chinese: 具有其他后缀的文件将原封不动。

definition: word for word/verbatim
from beginning to end/in its entirety/in accord with fact/literal
without missing a word
to copy/to follow the original shape/faithful restoration
to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
to copy/to imitate
to copy word for word
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
all of it/lock, stock and barrel
to pass on (stories)/to relate
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
no trace of politeness/unrestrained (criticism)
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms
serious about the matter
